jd.notes_for_resume:
- Lead end-to-end design of production-grade ML infrastructure and MLOps pipelines on distributed, microservices-based backends.
- Quantify reliability ownership: SLAs/SLOs, latency, throughput, and resource/cost utilization; include concrete metrics and outcomes.
- Emphasize Python as primary language; list secondary languages (Java/Go) where applicable.
- Showcase Docker- and Kubernetes-based deployment, autoscaling, and rollout strategies for real-time inference services.
- Detail model lifecycle management: CI/CD for models, model registry, monitoring/alerting, canary/shadow deployments, rollback procedures.
- Highlight cross-functional leadership with Data, Infrastructure, and ML Engineering teams; note scoping, timelines, and dependency management.
- Include examples of troubleshooting/observability improvements (dashboards, alerts) that improved uptime and performance.
- Demonstrate mentorship and knowledge-sharing initiatives (playbooks, runbooks, code reviews, brown bags).
- Add SQL/NoSQL and big data experience (e.g., Spark) if applicable.
- Call out any LLM/GenAI projects and optimizations (latency, cost, throughput), even POCs; mention domain impact relevant to digital health if applicable.

profile.headline: SENIOR MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER | GENERATIVE AI & MLOPS ARCHITECT

experience.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer & AI Solutions Architect
bullets: AI/ML lead for Medicaid integrity and care-management products, owning architecture, implementation, and productionization of ML and GenAI features.
Designed and deployed LLM-powered features on AWS Bedrock with RAG and vector search to generate fraud, provider risk, and patient risk narratives.
Built agentic AI workflows with LangGraph and Bedrock to orchestrate fraud pattern discovery, retrieval, and explanation generation.
Engineered HIPAA-compliant SageMaker and Glue (PySpark) pipelines processing 100M+ Medicaid claims annually with MLflow experiment tracking and governed deployments.
Operationalized supervised and unsupervised models for pre-pay claim scoring, post-pay audit selection, provider risk scoring, and patient risk stratification.
Implemented monitoring for data drift, performance, and bias using SageMaker/MLflow metrics and custom dashboards to meet SLOs.
Integrated scores and narratives into SIU, audit, and care-management workflows; collaborated with stakeholders to set risk tiers and thresholds.
Mentored engineers and analysts on GenAI, MLOps, Python best practices, and experiment design; contributed to standards for LLM/RAG pipelines.
Patient Risk Scoring: Designed features from claims, utilization, chronic conditions, SDOH; deployed on SageMaker with Glue pipelines; delivered explanations to outreach teams.
Provider Risk Scoring: Aggregated anomalies, billing behaviors, peer comparisons, and network relationships into provider risk scores; integrated outputs into Program Intelligence and SIU workflows.
Program Intelligence: Combined supervised models, anomaly detection, network analysis, and LLM narratives to detect FWA across Medicaid populations.
AuditStudio (North Dakota): Used PCA and KMeans to segment claims and identify outliers; built Glue PySpark ETL and Redshift/S3 integrations; calibrated thresholds and sampling strategies.
ClaimsSure: Built pre-pay fraud models (logistic regression, tree ensembles) with real-time SageMaker/Lambda scoring and explainability; optimized endpoint cost and p95 latency.

experience.title: Senior Associate Consultant
bullets: Enhanced Medicaid encounter and Open Health Plus systems for CMS and state reporting compliance, improving performance and data quality.
Developed and tuned PL/SQL procedures, triggers, and views; supported data issue analysis, defect triage, and production releases.

experience.title: Test Engineer
bullets: Led test automation and integration testing for FedEx eDD solutions, reducing manual regression effort and improving release reliability.
Built regression suites and test data strategies to validate high-throughput, multi-system workflows.

experience.title: Programmer
bullets: Supported HealthPAS system and integration testing for a state Medicaid program across claims, eligibility, and provider modules.
Developed utilities and scripts to streamline credentialing and test management; partnered with teams to diagnose production issues.

education: Nizam College — B.Sc., Mathematics, Physics, Electronics (Sep 2003 - May 2007) | Hyderabad, India

focus_skills: LLMs/Generative AI (AWS Bedrock, RAG, vector search)

tailored.headline: Senior MLOps Engineer | Generative AI & ML Infrastructure
tailored.summary: Senior MLOps Engineer with 18+ years in healthcare analytics leading end-to-end ML infrastructure, CI/CD, and reliable production deployments on AWS. Expert in Python, Docker, Kubernetes (EKS), SageMaker, Glue (PySpark), and MLflow with SLO/SLA-driven operations, real-time inference, and observability at scale (100M+ claims/year). Delivered LLM/RAG solutions on Bedrock and integrated risk scoring and fraud detection into mission-critical Medicaid workflows.

experience.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer & AI Solutions Architect

bullets.text: AI/ML lead for Medicaid integrity and care-management products, owning architecture, implementation, and productionization of ML and GenAI features across Data, Infra, and product teams.
Engineered a HIPAA-compliant ML platform on AWS—SageMaker training/inference, Glue (PySpark) distributed ETL, and MLflow experiment tracking—processing 100M+ Medicaid claims annually.
Built CI/CD for models and data pipelines with GitHub Actions, AWS CodePipeline/CodeBuild, and IaC, enabling repeatable builds, testing, and versioned releases to production endpoints.
Containerized model services with Docker and deployed/scaled workloads on Kubernetes (Amazon EKS) and SageMaker endpoints.
Delivered real-time inference for pre-pay claim scoring via SageMaker endpoints and AWS Lambda, optimizing endpoint cost and p95 latency.
Implemented monitoring for data drift, performance, and bias using SageMaker/MLflow metrics and custom dashboards; set SLOs and alerts to maintain reliability.
Instrumented logs and metrics across Glue jobs, endpoints, and Lambdas to improve troubleshooting and operational visibility.

Operationalized supervised and unsupervised models for pre-pay claim scoring, post-pay audit selection, provider risk scoring, and patient risk stratification; integrated outputs into SIU and care-management workflows.
Built LLM-powered features on AWS Bedrock with RAG and vector search; used LangGraph to orchestrate agentic workflows that discover fraud patterns and generate provider/patient risk narratives.
Orchestrated batch and real-time pipelines with AWS Step Functions and AWS Lambda; coordinated dependencies and SLAs with stakeholders.
Mentored engineers and analysts on Python, MLOps, and GenAI; led code reviews and contributed standards for LLM/RAG pipelines.
Developed and tuned PL/SQL procedures, triggers, and views for Medicaid encounter and Open Health Plus systems, improving performance and data quality for CMS and state reporting.
Supported data issue analysis, defect triage, and production releases; strengthened SQL/PLSQL reliability in high-volume reporting workflows.

tailored.resume_text:
NARENDER SURABHI
Senior MLOps Engineer | Generative AI & ML Infrastructure
Okemos, MI, USA 48864 | +1 (213) 254-8205 | surabhinarenderrao@gmail.com
LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/narendersurabhi | GitHub: github.com/narendersurabhi

Summary
Senior MLOps Engineer with 18+ years in healthcare analytics leading end-to-end ML infrastructure, CI/CD, and reliable production deployments on AWS. Expert in Python, Docker, Kubernetes (EKS), SageMaker, Glue (PySpark), and MLflow with SLO/SLA-driven operations, real-time inference, and observability at scale (100M+ claims/year). Delivered LLM/RAG solutions on Bedrock and integrated risk scoring and fraud detection into mission-critical Medicaid workflows.

Skills
- MLOps & ML Infrastructure: MLOps, model CI/CD (GitHub Actions, CodePipeline/CodeBuild); model deployment (SageMaker endpoints, AWS Lambda); monitoring & observability (drift/performance/bias, dashboards, alerts); SLO/SLA-driven operations; MLflow experiments and governed deployments
- Cloud & Orchestration: AWS SageMaker; AWS Glue (PySpark); Docker; Kubernetes (Amazon EKS); AWS Step Functions; AWS CloudFormation, IAM, VPC, Secrets Manager
- Data & Streaming: Distributed ETL (Glue PySpark); Amazon Redshift; Amazon S3; Kafka; SQL
- Programming: Python; Java
- LLMs & Generative AI: AWS Bedrock; RAG; vector search; LangGraph; GPT, Claude, LLaMA
- Security & Compliance: HIPAA/PHI/PII; IAM; VPC; AWS Secrets Manager

- Operationalized supervised and unsupervised models for pre-pay claim scoring, post-pay audit selection, provider risk scoring, and patient risk stratification; integrated outputs into SIU and care-management workflows.

issues.message: Microservices architecture is not explicitly demonstrated (service decomposition, API contracts, inter-service communication, service mesh).
Core CS fundamentals are not called out (data structures, algorithms) despite being a must-have.
Software design principles (SOLID, Clean Architecture, design patterns) are not mentioned.
Reliability ownership lacks concrete metrics (SLA/SLO targets, p95/p99 latency values, throughput/QPS, error budgets, cost per 1k inferences).
Kubernetes deployment details are high-level; autoscaling and rollout/rollback strategies are not specified (HPA/VPA, cluster autoscaler, blue/green, canary/shadow, Argo Rollouts/Flagger).
issues.location_hint: Skills: Cloud & Orchestration; Experience: Acentra Health

issues.message: Model registry and promotion workflow not explicitly cited (e.g., MLflow Model Registry with stage transitions and approval gates).
Observability/troubleshooting outcomes not quantified (MTTR/MTTD reduction, alert coverage, on-call improvements).
Distributed systems patterns are not detailed (idempotency, backpressure, partitioning, retry/DLQ semantics, exactly-once/at-least-once).
issues.location_hint: Experience: Acentra Health; Skills: Data & Streaming

issues.message: Cross-functional leadership lacks scope/timeline/dependency outcomes (e.g., roadmap ownership, delivery against milestones).

suggestions: Add a dedicated Microservices Architecture section: service decomposition for inference services, API gateway, gRPC/REST, circuit breakers, rate limiting, and (optionally) service mesh (Istio/Linkerd).
Quantify reliability: 99.9%+ SLA, SLOs (p95/p99 latency in ms), target QPS/throughput, error budget policy, and cost per 1k predictions before/after optimizations.
Detail Kubernetes practices: HPA/VPA policies, cluster autoscaler settings, resource requests/limits, PodDisruptionBudgets, and rollout strategies (blue/green, canary, shadow) with rollback criteria.
Call out model lifecycle explicitly: MLflow Model Registry usage, stage transitions (Staging->Prod), approval gates, model version pinning, and canary/shadow promotion workflows.
Expand observability: CloudWatch/Prometheus/Grafana dashboards, log aggregation (Fluent Bit/Fluentd), alert routing (PagerDuty), and MTTR/alert noise reductions with concrete metrics.

Document distributed systems patterns: Kafka consumer groups, partition strategy, idempotent processing, retries with backoff, DLQs, backpressure handling, and exactly-once semantics where applicable.
Include a brief CS fundamentals line: data structures/algorithms and software design principles (SOLID, Clean Architecture, common patterns) applied to ML services.
Provide concrete real-time inference metrics: endpoint concurrency, batch size, autoscaling thresholds, cold-start mitigation, and p95 latency improvements with numbers.
Highlight cross-functional leadership outcomes: scoped roadmap, dependencies managed across Data/Infra/Product, and on-time delivery percentages.
If applicable, add NoSQL experience (DynamoDB/MongoDB/Cassandra) and its use in features/metadata stores to strengthen nice-to-have coverage.
